description.narrative:
After Superstorm Sandy struck in October 2012, Doctors of the World worked swiftly to ensure that the most vulnerable Rockaways residents had access to free health care.
We soon realized we had to do more: on October 24, 2013, we opened the Doctors of the World Rockaways Free Clinic.
Our clinic provides free comprehensive primary healthcare consultations, free lab tests, one month of medications, and coordinated referral services to other healthcare providers and essential social services.

The Doctors of the World Rockaways Free Clinic provides basic healthcare services for adults without medical insurance. Staff members speak English, Spanish, French and Haitian Creole. All services provided by the clinic are free of charge, including:
- Adult primary and preventive healthcare services - Diabetes, hypertension and other chronic disease management - Community health education - Referrals to specialty medical care - Basic women’s health services - Basic cancer screenings - Case management services provided on-site by Catholic Charities Brooklyn-Queens - Mental health services provided on-site by the Visiting Nurse Service’s Disaster Distress Response program
